Trial.TitleDisplay: Assessment of Three Formulations of the Candidate Vaccine AMA 1 in Healthy Dutch Adult Volunteers
A Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of OZ-439 in Healthy Male and Female Subjects
Trial.Teaser: The part A of the study would investigate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of single oral escalating doses of OZ-439. Up to six dose levels would be investigated to estimate dose proportionality. In Part B, the effect of food on a single oral dose of OZ-439 would be investigated in a two-way crossover design. Part C would investigate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetic (PK) profile of multiple oral doses of OZ-439. The starting oral dose would be 50 mg and the maximum single dose to be administered would not exceed 1600 mg per subject. The maximum duration of dosing proposed was 3 days.

Trial.Teaser: By July 2004, results demonstrated that oral treatment of healthy male subjects with artemisone was safe and well tolerated [641340].This phase I trial of artemisone was initiated in December 2003 to assess the safety and tolerability of the drug against plasmodium infection.
